data.taskTitle: update ascii that shows when jat launches
data.approach: Make the ASCII banner colorful and beautiful - match JAT theme/logo colors

data.taskTitle: update ascii that shows when jat launches
summary: Replaced monochrome box with colorful gradient ASCII art matching JAT brand
J uses blue tones (C1/C2), A uses purple tones (C3/C4), T uses lavender→teal (C5/C6/C7)
Box frame uses dim gray (CB) to not compete with the art
Added 8 brand gradient color variables using 256-color ANSI codes
Updated CLAUDE.md to match new banner
reviewFocus: Check colors render correctly in your terminal

data.taskTitle: update ascii that shows when jat launches
data.approach: Fix backslash escape conflicts - the A letter backslashes merge with color codes. Also add gradient border with thicker box drawing chars.

data.taskTitle: update ascii that shows when jat launches
summary: Fixed backslash escape bug - switched from echo -e to $-quoting with plain echo
Thick double-line border (╔══║══╚) with gradient: blue→sky→lavender→teal
J=blue, A=sky/periwinkle, T=lavender→teal gradient across letters
Border left side matches J colors, right side matches T colors
All lines verified at 47 visible chars - perfect alignment
reviewFocus: Check colors in terminal - needs 256-color support

suggestedTasks.title: Add ASCII art rendering as configurable component
suggestedTasks.description:
Create a modular system for managing and rendering CLI ASCII art. This should include:
- Ability to swap or customize launch screen art
- Configuration file or mechanism for storing multiple art variations
- Potential support for theming or color variations
Target location: core CLI initialization module.
suggestedTasks.reason: Current implementation is hardcoded and lacks flexibility

gotchas: Ensure art renders consistently across different terminal sizes

documentationNeeds: Update CLI documentation to reflect new launch screen
